concept.title: Couchbase Web UI
concept.shortdesc: The Couchbase Web UI allows easy access to documents using your web browser.

conbody.p: Couchbase’s administration console provides some functionality for accessing data. Items may be created, retrieved, updated, and remove using this interface. Note that this interface is a GUI interface available via the web UI only, and should be used for informational/development purposes only (there is no REST API to access data). Note: Editing of documents within the UI is only possible on documents up-to 2.5kb in size.

To access documents using the Web UI:
Navigate your browser to a cluster node. Type the address of the cluster with the port (8091).
The password is the password you used when setting up the cluster
Once logged in, go to the Data Buckets section:
Click on the documents button of the default bucket. (We’ll learn more about buckets later on):
To retrieve a document, type in the document ID and click on “Lookup ID”:
This will take you to the document page where you can view and edit the document.
To create a new document, go back to the ‘Documents’ section and click on ‘Create Document’
You’ll be prompted to enter a document ID:
Once created, you can now edit your document. Don't forget to save when done
